intro: Hieracium homophyllum, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves that are typically lobed or toothed. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Hieracium homophyllum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
